content.en: Fluorescence Cancer Diagnosis: Researchers have been investigating the use of fluorescence spectroscopy to improve the noninvasive diagnosis of various types of cancer. They have developed diagnostic algorithms that can distinguish between normal and abnormal tissue sites in the oral cavity and cervix. These algorithms analyze the fluorescence spectra at different excitation wavelengths and use techniques like principal component analysis and support vector machine algorithms for classification. The goal is to enhance the accuracy of cancer detection and potentially reduce the need for invasive procedures.
content.da: Fluorescens Kræftdiagnose: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af fluorescensspektroskopi til at forbedre den ikke-invasive diagnose af forskellige typer kræft. De har udviklet diagnostiske algoritmer, der kan skelne mellem normale og unormale vævssteder i mundhulen og livmoderhalsen. Disse algoritmer analyserer fluorescensspektre ved forskellige exciteringsbølgelængder og anvender teknikker som principal komponentanalyse og support vector maskine algoritmer til klassifikation. Målet er at forbedre nøjagtigheden af kræftopdagelse og potentielt reducere behovet for invasive procedurer.
